events.title: Do This First
events.description:
JMD: submitVia field, filled. Deliverable field, filled.
First, get some idea about how this course is organized. Read ALL the information within the Blackboard "START HERE" section. Then, go to the Topics section here in the PLE and look at the first Topic. It has a subtopic, Let's Get Started, that explains the servers involved in the course.  

Below, there are several administrative assignments that you should complete as soon as possible.  You cannot participate in the course without completing them.  These include the following:


Getting a CS department account
Completing the course infomation form and getting a course password
Completing the course syllabus and submitting it
Making sure your Oracle account is set up properly


The Administrivia Checklist and Course Guide will help you get started.

Secondly, you should get going on the actual course content. This includes the other assignments and topics sections, as well as the material in resources.

events.title: Required Reading
events.description:
JMD: submit via field, blank. Deliverable field, blank.
Textbook chapters:






Elmasri,  Databases and Database Users
Elmasri,  Database Systems Concepts & Architecture
Elmasri,  Disk Storage, Basic File Structure and Hashing (selections):

Buffering of Blocks
Placing File Records on Disk
Operations on Files
Files of Unsorted Records (Heap Files)
Files of Ordered Records (Sorted Files)
Hashing Techniques
Other Primary File Organizations


Elmasri, Indexing Structure for Files (selections):

Types of Single-Level Ordered Indexes
Multilevel Indexes
Dynamic Multilevel Indexes Using B-Trees and B+-Trees
